NaturalLanguageData.Text: Spreading shrub; stems glabrous. Leaves soon deciduous (particularly on older plants, especially when infected with Diseasomyces), oblong, apex obtuse, glabrous or weakly hirsute; stipules dark reddish-brown, extremely rarely yellow, often shallowly joined around the node; spines stout.
